Add the possibility to order the albums by release date in the library.

Fixes #114.

This commit allows the user to select between 'alphabet' and 'release' in the preferences for the default ordering for albums in the LibraryFragment.
The default setting is 'alphabet'.

If the albums are sorted by release, the release year is added as prefix in front of the album title, like: '2015 - Album title'.
In case of alphabetical ordering just the album title is displayed.

If an artist is added to Clementine's playlist, this setting is respected (therefore the titles are added by release year or alphabet).

Custom small notification with play / pause and next button. Replaces the default notification.
Add padding for buttons in widget and notification.

Fix ViewPager swipe on metadata. Apparenly, TextViews with `android:singleLine='true'` don't pass the swipe events to the ViewPager. Changing it to `android:maxLines='1'` fixes this.

See https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=37256

Enable the download of every song in the library. Either long click on items in playlist or the library to download them.

- Improved download fragment and items

Fixes #38
Open a list dialog when clicking a finished download with all downloaded songs. A click on a item plays the track.

Now the artist and album subfolder can be switched on or off independently of the playlist.

Rework library. New groupings can be easily added and selected in the settings (Currently only Artist / Album).

- New grouping setting in library preferences.
- Moved library classes in own package.
- Moved library database code to new class LibraryDatabaseHelper.
- Library Fragment is not coupled to a specific grouping anymore.

Updates #44.
Fix crash when entering library view.

- Move genre, year and time inside album art overlay.
- Remove unused colors.

Rework library (again). It is now possible to group the library like in Clementine itself. Custom grouping is not (yet) implemented.

- Grouping can be set in the settings.
- Ordering can be set to ascending and descending.

Fixes #44.

After Toolbar collapses, all child views are set to `View.VISIBLE`. In library, after closing the search the spinner was shown. This fixes this issue.

See: https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=78160 & http://stackoverflow.com/questions/28497844/support-toolbar-versus-support-search-view
